description: From pro- (from Ancient Greek πρό (pró, “before”)) +‎ lact- (variation of lacto-, from Latin lac (“milk”)) +‎ -in (modification of -ine).

entries.meaning: (biochemistry) A peptide gonadotrophic hormone secreted by the pituitary gland; it stimulates growth of the mammary glands and lactation in females.
examples: Men get a dose of the hormone prolactin after orgasm and this acts as a sedative.
